item.title: AIPals
item.description:
Role: Researcher

Funding: FCT

Description:

This project’s objective was to produce non-stationary Markov models that characterize the flow of students in the Portuguese educational system to obtain predictions of the respective evolution.

In my contribution, I used Markov models, sequential pattern-mining and clustering to model, predict and profile the sequential datasets.

item.title: CIRCLES
item.description:
Role: Researcher

Funding: European Union (under Horizon 2020 research and innovation program)

item.title: ModEst
item.description:
Role: Researcher

Funding: FCT (under the Data Science and Artificial Intelligence in Public Administration program)

Description:

This project’s objective was to advance precision medicine and supportive care in ALS by proposing advanced machine learning models using patient profiles and disease progression patterns for prognostic prediction in ALS.

My worked focused on the problem of analyzing n-way data using deep reinforcement learning approaches.
